abstract.p: Prof Richard Barsness letter on Aug 22 article on flight delays says major changes are needed in both structure and air traffic system and operating practices

block.p: Re ''Meeting Holds Out Little Hope of Easing Flight Delays Soon'' (news article, Aug. 22):

Major changes are needed in both the structure of the air traffic system and operating practices. Antitrust immunity would be necessary (and appropriate) for airlines to participate in collective discussion of these matters. Participation by organized labor is also essential.
Re ''Meeting Holds Out Little Hope of Easing Flight Delays Soon'' (news article, Aug. 22):

Major changes are needed in both the structure of the air traffic system and operating practices. Antitrust immunity would be necessary (and appropriate) for airlines to participate in collective discussion of these matters. Participation by organized labor is also essential.

A summit meeting, with advance preparation, should be followed by a national commission to work out a more detailed framework, plan of action and financing. The commission would represent the principal aviation interest groups as well as Congress and the public.
Given the lead time required for some of the changes, the summit meeting and national commission should be a top priority after the election.
The writer is a professor of management at Lehigh University.
